actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase from 12 to 36 months the period for which benefits may be paid to an individual prior to the actual time of his or her application for such benefits.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Increases from twelve to thirty-six months the period for which benefits may be paid to an individual prior to the actual time of his or her application for such benefits under the old-age, survivors, and disability insurance program of the Social Security Act.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase from 12 to 36 months the period for which benefits may be paid to an individual prior to the actual time of his or her application for such benefits.
